'''25w06a''' is the fifth [[snapshot]] for [[Java Edition 1.21.5]], released on February 5, 2025,<ref>{{snap|25w06a|id=a|February 5, 2025}}</ref> which adds [[cactus flower]]s, short and tall dry grass, new chicken variants and fixes bugs.

== Additions ==
=== Blocks ===
'''[[File:Cactus Flower JE1.png|32px]] [[Cactus flower]]'''
* A new type of flower which has a chance of generating on cacti in [[desert]]s and [[badland]]s.
* Can be placed on cactus blocks or any block which has center support at the top of the block.
* Has a chance of growing on cactus blocks.
** If a cactus is one or two blocks high the flower has a 10% chance to grow instead of the cactus getting higher.
** If a cactus is three blocks or higher the flower has a 25% chance to grow.
** Cactus flowers will only grow if they have space on all four sides.
* Can be mined without any tool.
* Can be used in the [[composter]], with a 30% chance to add a layer.
* Can be used to craft 1 [[pink dye]].

{{Crafting|Cactus Flower
|Output = Pink Dye
|shapeless = 1
|ignoreusage = 1
}}

'''[[File:Short Dry Grass.png|32px]] [[Short dry grass]]''' 
* Is one block high.
* Generates in the [[desert]] and [[badlands]].
* Can be placed on types of [[sand]], [[terracotta]] and [[dirt block]]s like the [[dead bush]].
* Can be obtained using [[shears]] or a [[Silk Touch]] tool.
* Can be bone mealed.
** Using [[bone meal]] on short dry grass grows it into a tall dry grass.
* Can be used in the [[composter]], with a 30% chance to add a layer.
* [[Sheep]] can eat short dry grass to regrow its wool.
* Can be used as fuel for smelting, where they smelt half an item.

'''[[File:Tall Dry Grass.png|32px]] [[Tall dry grass]]'''
* Is one block high.
* Generates in the [[desert]] and [[badlands]].
* Can be placed on types of [[sand]], [[terracotta]] and [[dirt block]]s like the [[dead bush]].
* Can be obtained using [[shears]] or a [[Silk Touch]] tool.
* Can be bone mealed.
** Using [[bone meal]] on tall dry grass places a neighbouring short dry grass next to the block if possible.
* Can be used in the [[composter]], with a 30% chance to add a layer.
* [[Sheep]] can eat tall dry grass to regrow its wool.
* Can be used as fuel for smelting, where they smelt half an item.

=== Items ===
'''[[File:Blue Egg.png|32px]] [[Blue egg]]'''
* A variant of the [[egg]] laid by the cold chicken variant.
* Spawns the cold chicken variant when hatched.

'''[[File:Brown Egg.png|32px]] [[Brown egg]]'''
* A variant of the [[egg]] laid by the warm chicken variant.
* Spawns the warm chicken variant when hatched.

=== Mobs ===
'''{{Animate|Chicken JE2 BE2.png; Cold Chicken.png; Warm Chicken.png|32px}} [[Chicken]]'''
* New Chicken variants have been added.
**{{EntityLink|Chicken|Temperate Chicken}}: The pre-existing chicken variant.
***Spawns by default where the cold and warm chicken variants do not spawn.
**{{EntityLink|Cold Chicken}}: A variant that spawns in the following biomes:
*** {{BiomeLink|Old Growth Pine Taiga}}
*** {{BiomeLink|Old Growth Spruce Taiga}}
*** {{BiomeLink|Taiga}}
*** {{BiomeLink|Snowy Taiga}}
*** {{BiomeLink|Windswept Hills}}
*** {{BiomeLink|Windswept Gravelly Hills}}
*** {{BiomeLink|Windswept Forest}}
**{{EntityLink|Warm Chicken|Warm Chicken}}: A variant that spawns in the following biomes:
*** {{BiomeLink|Savanna}}
*** {{BiomeLink|Savanna Plateau}}
*** {{BiomeLink|Windswept Savanna}}
*** {{BiomeLink|Jungle}}
*** {{BiomeLink|Sparse Jungle}}
*** {{BiomeLink|Bamboo Jungle}}
*** {{BiomeLink|Eroded Badlands}}
*** {{BiomeLink|Wooded Badlands}}
*** {{BiomeLink|Badlands}}
* When bred by a [[player]], a baby chicken variant will not be chosen by the current biome, but instead randomly selected from one of the parents' variants.

=== General ===
'''[[Game rule]]'''
* Added the {{cd|allowFireTicksAwayFromPlayer}} game rule.
** Default value: {{cd|false}}.
** When {{cd|true}}, Fire and Lava ticks can occur outside of an 8 chunk range of a player.

'''[[Tag]]'''
* Added the {{cd|#edible_for_sheep}} block tag.
** Contains blocks that can be eaten by [[sheep]] to regrow their [[wool]].

* Added the {{cd|#eggs}} item tag.
** Contains all variants of the [[egg]] item.

== Changes ==
=== Blocks ===
[[File:Bush JE1.png|width=32x32]] '''[[Bush]]'''
* The hitbox now reaches all the way to the ground.
* No longer prevents [[tree]]s from growing.

'''[[Fire]]'''
* Will no longer burn or spread if no player is within 8 chunks.

'''[[Firefly bush]]'''
* Conditions for the firefly bush playing ambient sounds have changed. It now plays when all of the following conditions are met:
** The firefly bush is not blocked from above by any collidable block (except [[leaves]]).
** It is nighttime.
* No longer prevents [[tree]]s from growing.

'''[[Leaf litter]]'''
* Can now be placed on any block which has center support at the top of the block.
* Now have a more appropriate color on maps.

'''General'''
* Any block in the simulation distance of a player or loaded by another source of chunk loading (such as [[ender pearl]]s) may now receive random ticks, instead of just 8 chunks around players.
** For example: if a chunk is loaded by an [[ender pearl]] or is in the spawn chunks, crops are able to grow, [[ice]] can melt, [[snow]] can fall, and a [[cauldron]] can be filled by rain.
** Mob spawning, lava spreading fire, and lightning strikes still occur in the previous radius of 8 chunks around players.

=== Items ===
'''[[Cake]]s and [[pumpkin pie]]s'''
* Can now be crafted using [[blue egg]]s or [[brown egg]]s.

=== Mobs ===
'''[[Bee]]s'''
* Are now attracted to, and can be bred using [[cactus flower]]s.

=== World generation ===
'''[[Village]]s'''
* Pigs and cows spawned in desert villages are now of the warm variant.

=== Gameplay ===
'''[[Advancement]]s'''
* The "Country Lode, Take Me Home" advancement has been moved from the Nether category to the Adventure category.

=== General ===
'''[[Data pack]]'''
* The [[pack format]] version is now {{cd|66}}.

'''Entity data'''
* The armor and off-hand equipment of players is now also stored in the {{cd|equipment}} field.
** Although items written into the Inventory using armor and off-hand slot numbers still work.

'''Entity variant components'''
* Chicken variants can be data-driven adding entries to <code>data/<namespace>/chicken_variant/<id>.json</code>.
** This feature is experimental.
** Fields in file:
*** <code>model</code> - one of: <code>normal</code>, <code>cold</code>.
*** <code>asset_id</code> - namespaced id for this variant asset, resolves to <code>assets/<namespace>/textures/<path>.png</code>.
*** <code>spawn_conditions</code> - field described in uniform variant selection above.

'''[[Resource pack]]'''
* The [[pack format]] version is now {{cd|51}}.
* Added new textures for chicken variants:
** <code>cold_chicken</code>
** <code>warm_chicken</code>
* The texture <code>chicken</code> has been renamed to <code>temperate_chicken</code>.
* The <code>temperate_chicken</code> texture has been moved to a new folder:
** <code>entity/chicken.png</code> -> <code>entity/chicken/temperate_chicken.png</code>

'''[[Tag]]'''
* The {{cd|#dead_bush_may_place_on}} block tag has been renamed to {{cd|#dry_vegetation_may_place_on}}.
* Added {{cd|cactus_flower}} to the {{cd|#bee_attractive}}, and {{cd|#flowers}} block tags, and the {{cd|#bee_food}} item tag.
* Added {{cd|bush}}, {{cd|firefly_bush}}, {{cd|short_dry_grass}}, and {{cd|tall_dry_grass}} to the {{cd|#replaceable_by_mushrooms}}, and {{cd|#replaceable_by_trees}} block tags.
* Added {{cd|short_dry_grass}}, and {{cd|tall_dry_grass}} to the {{cd|#replaceable}} block tag.
* Added many biomes to the {{cd|#spawns_cold_variant_farm_animals}}, and {{cd|#spawns_warm_variant_farm_animals}} biome tags.

'''[[Tooltip]]'''
* Tooltips for [[fireworks]] and [[crossbows]] now show a compact form of multiple repeated stars or projectiles that are identical.
